questions.question: Where is the battle site where Napoleon Bonaparte faced a decisive defeat in 1815, leading to the end of his rule?
questions.context: This location is famous for the battle that took place in June 1815 and marked the downfall of Napoleon Bonaparte's army.

questions.question: Which city houses a famous museum opened in 1793, originally a royal palace and now home to the Mona Lisa?
questions.context: This museum is known for having over 35,000 works and was once a fortress before becoming a symbol of art and culture.

questions.question: Where can you find the ruins of the ancient city believed to have been buried by volcanic ash in AD 79?
questions.context: This well-preserved ancient city offers a glimpse into Roman life and was rediscovered in the 18th century.

questions.question: Which architectural marvel, opened in 1931, was the tallest building in the world until 1970 and is an iconic symbol of a U.S. city?

answer.label: Empire State Building, New York City, USA

questions.context: This skyscraper, located in Manhattan, has 102 stories and has appeared in numerous films, making it part of popular culture.

questions.question: What UNESCO site consists of a collection of prehistoric megalith monuments, believed to have been constructed around 3100 BC?
questions.context: Located on Salisbury Plain, this site is one of the wonders of the ancient world and aligns with the solstices.
